titlestmt.titleproper: Bertram Lippincott O'Neill genealogical research materials 1907-1989 1967-1989
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Bertram Lippincott O'Neill genealogical research materials
did.repository: The Historical Society of Pennsylvania 1300 Locust Street Philadelphia, PA 19107

bioghist.p: Bertram Lippincott O'Neill (1919-2002) lived in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. He worked in his family's insurance business, W. C. O'Neill Sons, for over 20 years, then served as a vice president of Aluminum Biclimatic Corporation. He also owned a retail store called La Boutique. He served on the boards of The Historical Society of Pennsylvania, the Genealogical Society of Pennsylvania, the Pennsylvania Academy of Fine Arts, and the U.S. Court Tennis Association. His was married to Jane O'Neill and they had a son, Bertram, Jr.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists of genealogical research on the Lippincott family and allied families such as Reeves, Biddle, Selous, Coles, Goodwin, Crawford, and Wharton. Materials include: divorce decrees, marriage announcements, marriage licenses, birth certificates, and other vital and legal records; copies of newspaper clippings; correspondence related to the research; personal and genealogical correspondence with family members; photographs; personal memorabilia and printed materials from organizations and clubs in which family members participated; family charts; and obituaries.Information was compiled from various archives and public records offices, as well as other family members.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: An inventory is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Historical Society of Pennsylvania: Bertram Lippincott O'Neill papers (coll. 3011).
